A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The first movie I ever saw in a theater was Star Wars in the summer of 1977. Like most people my age\, Star Wars was the greatest part of my childhood. By the time the prequels came along\, I was a father and introduced my son to the saga. Now\, after seeing this hot pile of crap\, I wonder how it all went so wrong. I have watched this movie three more times via a friend’s iTunes download...still\, nothing. The movie just wasn’t very good at all. Starts off with a corny crank call. A needless side story to a casino planet (I feel so bad for Kelly Marie Tran). A missed opportunity to send off Leia with a purpose (don’t get me started on Leia “Poppins”). A waste of a legendary Jedi. A waste of a worthwhile villain. Last and worst of all...the flashbacks! Flashbacks are a lazy storytelling technique that have no place in Star Wars. What was Disney thinking? What was Rian Johnson thinking...he’s a hack?!? I wonder if Lucas regrets selling his franchise now. This just wasn’t a good movie. Episode IX will most likely be the first Star Wars movie that I’ll wait a few weeks to see just to find out how it’s received before I spend my money. Good luck J.J. Abrams...Johnson set the bar so low and weighed it down with so much utter BS\, you’ll have a tall task of lifting the series back up and\, if what you did to Star Trek is any indication\, I’m not holding out much hope.
